intro: Schefflera morobeana, commonly known as the Morobe schefflera, is a flowering plant native to the island of Morobe in Papua New Guinea. It belongs to the Araliaceae family and is characterized by its dense, umbrella-like arrangement of leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in panicles, followed by orange-red berries. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
